meanings.definition: Capable of being the cause of something.
meanings.sent1: The storm was causable of the power outage.
meanings.sent2: His careless actions were causable of the accident.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was causable of stealing all the nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter was causable of smiles all around.
meanings.sent5: The slippery floor was causable of many falls.

meanings.definition: Able to be influenced or affected by something.
meanings.sent1: Young minds are causable of new ideas.
meanings.sent2: Her fragile emotions were causable of tears.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat was causable of getting stuck in the tree.
meanings.sent4: His open heart was causable of deep connections.
meanings.sent5: The flexible schedule was causable of spontaneous adventures.
